body:
I'm not sure what you mean by *Shift* + RMB, since you just have it bound to RMB, which is reserved for selection expansion since 0.5.0. Of course shift is used to bypass mouse mode which is used in many alternate screen applications like htop.

I think the best choice is likely just to use middle mouse to paste, like common on other operating systems already. Do you want to disable selection expansion completely?

Ah, my apologies, and thank you for the quick reply. I wasn't aware of the selection expansion feature. I use a trackpad on macOS (which doesn't have a middle-click that I know of), and yes I've used `shift` to bypass mouse mode for copy/paste inside tmux.

Now that I understand it, I do like the selection expansion feature, but I rely too much on the copy/paste in tmux currently.

A couple ideas:

- Providing a way to disable selection expansion would unblock me
- OR could selection expansion be bound to `shift + ctrl` (or similar) instead? (I think this would unblock copy/paste in tmux _and_ selection expansion)

I'm open to other options as well.

> OR could selection expansion be bound to shift + ctrl (or similar) instead? (I think this would unblock copy/paste in tmux and selection expansion)

Control is already used for block selection expansion, so that is not free. The only bindings that are not used are alt + left/right.

While it might make some sense to enable binding things to alt + left/right without triggering the base actions, I do not think it makes sense to remap any of the existing functionality. There are so many different things occupying nearly every of the main mouse buttons that remapping them just doesn't make a lot of sense.
@kchibisov Do you think we should have the ability to suppress mouse actions when a binding was triggered, similar to key bindings?
I'm not sure, maybe we can do something like that, but I'm not sure how useful can it be. From what I can tell I don't see much value in that.

Yeah, that's my main concern too. At that point it's not really about *remapping* something, but more about disabling a built-in feature. And while I can see that some people might not want to use certain features like selection expansion, I'm not sure how much sense it makes to let them disable it and bind it to something else.

The density of bindings on the mouse is relatively high, so I think the main benefit of custom mouse bindings is for auxiliary buttons and maybe binding to some things that do nothing. I'm not so sure about overriding built-in options.

That said, alt + right/left is currently not bound to anything, but cannot be used since we just ignore the modifier. So I don't see a good reason why we wouldn't exclude that from our bindings explicitly so the user can make use of that. But I don't see a lot of users binding things to alt + RMB/LMB anyways.

Thanks again for considering. I realize this "click-to-copy then right-click-to-paste" behavior is just my own habits that I maybe got from using iTerm. I understand that trying to walk a line through all of these mouse and keyboard event bindings may end up complicating the long-term maintenance of the app overall, so I'll defer to your expertise in whether these built-in features and events should be able to be "rebound" or not.

Since I am in tmux most of the time, I did find a workaround for that environment. I'll post here for anyone else who may encounter this (requires `xclip` installed).

```tmux
# Enable tmux mouse support
set -g mouse on

# Enable drag to select and copy text via copy-mode-vi
bind-key -T copy-mode-vi MouseDragEnd1Pane send -X copy-pipe-and-cancel "xclip -select clipboard -i"

# Paste with right click
unbind-key -n MouseDown3Pane # unbind default right click
bind-key -n MouseDown3Pane run " \
  X=$(xclip -o -sel clipboard); \
  tmux set-buffer \"$X\"; \
  tmux paste-buffer -p; \
  tmux display-message 'pasted!' \
"
```

issue.title: Add configuration flag for right-click selection
issue.body:
This add a flag to the `selection` section of the configuration file called `right_click_expand` that defaults to `true`.  If it is set to `false`, the right-click behaviour that expands the selection is disabled, allowing other actions to be performed involving the selection without it changing.

Fixes #4132

issue.title: Right mouse to paste only -- no selection?
issue.body:

issue.title: Add ExpandSelection as a configurable binding
issue.body:
This adds a new action called `ExpandSelection` that by default is bound to the right mouse button. This allows users to chose whether to keep that binding or remove it (or even map it to a different mouse button).

When implementing this, I mirrored `ViAction` in that it is a different `enum` and is only available on mouse bindings similar to how `ViAction`s are only available in vi mode.

I moved the logic from `on_right_click` and `expand_selection` into event listener, but there is one piece I'm not sure about that I'll highlight below.

I had to move `process_mouse_bindings` before `on_mouse_press` as it is responsible for noticing when double- and triple-clicks occur, but I don't think this will have any negative side-effects.

Replaces #5194
Fixes #4132

body:
And another one :-)

I want to get rid of the bloated iTerm2, which sadly just worked out of the box.
I then tried Kitty, but I cannot get it to copy-paste whole lines incl. the newline with a tripple-click.
So I would like to try Alacritty instead ....

I need to copy on select and paste on right-mouse button.
My middle mouse button is awkward to reach and also a mouse-wheel, which makes it pretty unusable.
Also, I am just used to use the right mouse button to paste on all devices.

Any chance to offer a way to remove this default "selection extension" (which I never ever in my whole live used or ever will use) from the right mouse button?

> @tjatjagithub This will be fixed in the upcoming 0.10 release as long as you have
> 
> ```yaml
> mouse_bindings:
>   - { mouse: Right, action: Paste }
> ```
> 
> in your configuration file.

Ohhh, I am so happy :-)
Any ETA?
No ETA on anything ever, but 0.10 is currently pretty thin so probably not for a bit.

With latest https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/5340 `alacritty` still combines selection event in `right mouse click` despite of having set `Right` to action `Paste` only:
```
mouse_bindings:
  - { mouse: Right, action: Paste }
```

Even you have only above mouse bindings in your config, the left/right mouse always keep setting to `ExpandSelection` anyway and if you start to use `left mouse` to select text, then you also trigger `right mouse` to select text also that mess up paste function.

This makes `right mouse` to paste to work but not reliable to use because user probably will do a right mouse *click* to select anyway by mistake in middle of high workload.

Currently I don't bother to use right mouse click to paste, instead I set it to *None* to disable it:
```
mouse_bindings:
  - { mouse: Right, action: None }
```

Remove selection from right mouse completely is what to be wanted.
